meanings.definition: A toll or tax paid for the privilege of passing over a road or bridge.
meanings.sent1: The pedage to cross the bridge was only a few coins.
meanings.sent2: Drivers had to pay the pedage before entering the highway.
meanings.sent3: The troll at the bridge demanded pedage in the form of shiny pebbles.
meanings.sent4: The pedage acted as a gatekeeper, allowing only those who paid to pass.
meanings.sent5: The pedage booth was decorated with colorful flags to attract travelers.

meanings.definition: To impose a toll or tax on.
meanings.sent1: The government decided to pedage all vehicles using the new road.
meanings.sent2: The city council voted to pedage the entrance to the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous leprechaun tried to pedage the path with gold coins.
meanings.sent4: The king pedaged the river, demanding a portion of the fish caught.
meanings.sent5: The wizard's spell seemed to pedage anyone who dared to cross the threshold.
